frame.name: Bounded_region
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Exterior</fen>, <fen>Surface</fen>, <fen>Boundary</fen>, and <fen>Interior</fen> are picked out relative to the <fen>Ground</fen>. This <fen>Ground</fen> may either occupy only the <fen>Boundary</fen> (in which case the <fen>Interior</fen> is negative space) or the <fen>Ground</fen> may fill the <fen>Interior</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Interior
FE.definition: <def-root>A region of space located inside a <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity whose location is relatively well-known and which, thus, can serve as a land-mark to identify the <fen>Interior</fen>, <fen>Surface</fen>, <fen>Boundary</fen>, or <fen>Exterior</fen> regions.</def-root>

FE.name: Surface
FE.definition: <def-root>The region located outside of, but in contact with, the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Boundary
FE.definition: <def-root>The region associated with the boundary of the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Exterior
FE.definition: <def-root>The region which is not located inside or in contact with the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>
